title: Jeff Sessions
added: Throughout the campaign Sessions repeatedly defended attacks from the president on twitter.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Romero |title=Jeff Sessions stands up to former boss Trump on Twitter |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/elections/jeff-sessions-stands-former-boss-trump-twitter-n1213621 |website=NBC News |accessdate=7 October 2020}}</ref> On May 22nd, 2020 President Trump tweeted "3 years ago, after Jeff Sessions recused himself, the Fraudulent Mueller Scam began. Alabama, do not trust Jeff Sessions. He let our Country down."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1263970567838932993 |website=Twitter |accessdate=7 October 2020}}</ref> Sessions responded the next day by tweeting: "Mr. President, Alabama can and does trust me, as do conservatives across the country. Perhaps you’ve forgotten. They trusted me when I stepped out and put that trust on the line for you."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/jeffsessions/status/1264208610671943682 |website=Twitter |accessdate=7 October 2020}}</ref>. The president responded by continuing to deride sessions, while encouraging him to drop out of the race entirely.
